p: Lipopolysaccharide (LPS) is bio-active component of the Gram-negative bacterial cell wall [ 9], and has been used to establish a mouse model of ALI [ 5]. LPS activates reactive oxygen species (ROS) generation and the release of proteases. Furthermore, LPS induces the activation of NF-ÎºB signaling pathway and cytokine release [ 10, 11]. Inflammatory mediators activate overproduction of ROS, leading to more oxidative damage. Therefore, suppression of oxidative stress and/or inflammation is a potential strategy to improve ALI.
